position.marginalia_text: Pol: If you call me, Jeptha, my Lord, I| have a daughter that I love passing well| Ham. Nay, that follows not.

substitution.copyText: Ros. I think their inhibition comes by the means of the late in-| novation
and those that would make mouths at him while my father, lived,| give twenty, forty, fiftay, a hundred duckets a piece for his picture| in little:
substitution.amendedText: and those that would make mouths at him while my father, lived,| give twenty, forty, fiftay, nay a hundred duckets a piece for his picture| in little:

substitution.copyText: let me comply with you in this garb, ''Left my extent to the Play-| ''ers, which I tell you must shew farily outwards, should more ap-| ''pear like entertainment than yours; you are welocome:
Hark you Guildenstern, and you too, aat each ear a hearer,
that great baby you see is not yet out of his swadling clouts.
substitution.amendedText: that great baby you see yonder is not yet out of his swadling clouts.

substitution.copyText: I will prophesie that he comes to tell me of the Players,| mark it: YOu say right Sir, Monday morning 'twas then indeed.
substitution.amendedText: I will prophesie that he comes to tell me of the Players,| mark it -- YOu say right, Sir; for on Monday morning 'twas then, indeed.

substitution.copyText: My Lord I have news to tell you:
substitution.amendedText: My Lord, I have news to tell you:

substitution.copyText: Then came each actor in his Ass
substitution.amendedText: Then came each actor in his Ass--

substitution.copyText: O feptha Judge of Israel what a treasure hadst thou
substitution.amendedText: O feptha Judge of Israel what a treasure hadst thou!

substitution.copyText: Pol: If you call me, Jeptha, my Lord, I| have a daughter that I love passing well| Ham. Nay, that follows not.
